description: Ultimate is a program analysis framework. Ultimate consists of several plugins that perform steps of an program analysis, e.g., parsing source code, transforming programs from one representation to another, or analyze programs. Toolchains of these plugins can perform complex tasks, e.g., verify that a C program fulfills a given specification.

sections.title: Development
sections.content:
Most Ultimate developers are students and researchers in the software engineering group of Andreas Podelski at the University of Freiburg. Current and former developers of Ultimate are

Alexander Nutz
Alex Saukh (web interface, CDT interface, CACSL2Boogie, Büchi minimization)
Arend v. Reinersdorff (predecessor of ULTIMATE)
Betim Musa (automata script, interpolants from unsatisfiable cores)
Björn Buchhold (predecessor of ULTIMATE, the 2.0 version)
Chen Kefei (nested interpolants)
Christian Ortolf (predecessor of ULTIMATE)
Christian Schilling (NWA minimization)
Christian Simon (predecessor of ULTIMATE, the 2.0 version)
Christoph Hofmann (Ultimate in the cloud)
Daniel Dietsch
Daniel Christiany (NWA)
Evren Ermis
Fabian Reiter (Büchi complementation)
German Fordinal
Jan Leike (NWA, LassoRanker)
Jan Hättig (total interpolation)
Jan Mortensen (NWA, petri nets)
Jelena Barth (Jung visualization)
Jeremi Dzienian (Temporal Properties)
Julian Jarecki (petri nets)
Jochen Hoenicke
Jürgen Christ
Justus Bisser
Markus Lindenmann (web interface, CDT interface, CACSL2Boogie, Büchi minimierung, C memory model)
Markus Pomrehn (formula simplification, alternating automata)
Markus Zeiger (NWA, E-Matching)
Marius Greitschus
Matthias Heizmann
Matthias Keil (Prefuse visualization)
Nicola Sheldrick (predecessor of ULTIMATE)
Robert Jakob (predecessor of ULTIMATE)
Simon Ley (IC3)
Stefan Wissert (Web interface, CDT interface, CACSL2Boogie, IValuations, large block encoding)
Vincent Langenfeld (Temporal Properties, LTL software model checking)
Xiaolin Wu (emptiness check for Büchi nested word automata)

The core of Ultimate and many plugins are subject to the LGPLv3 license with a linking exception to Eclipse RCP and Eclipse CDT. We are planing to release the source code of Ultimate on this website, meanwhile the source code is available on request.

sections.title: Dependencies
sections.content:
Many plugins in Ultimate require an SMT-LIB compatible theorem prover. We use SMTInterpol.

Ultimate uses Eclipse RCP. Plugins that handle C code depend on Eclipse CDT.
